title: No children node listing when changing data source for a data set in data set editor page of the query tab
description: The issue occurs when trying to change the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab. When attempting to do this, the children nodes are not being listed.
OB: When changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab, the expected behavior is to list out the children of the new data source.
EB: The actual behavior is that no children nodes are being listed when changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab.
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 
1. Create a data set without a SQL statement. 
2. Open the data set editor and go to the data source page. 
3. Change the data source to a new one. 
4. The new data source does not display any database/table/column information as children nodes. 
To resolve the issue, close the data set editor and reopen it.
